Subject: Re: [junit] Question about testing GUI
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=106503903

There are several libraries which work with JUnit to provide control  
over the operation of a UI.  as JB suggested, if you have no experience  
with it, it is useful to get a guide from someone who has, whether it  
be a book or a wiki.

tools:  
http://groups.yahoo.com/group/java-gui-testing/links/ 
Tools_001036939323/
informative links: http://groups.yahoo.com/group/java-gui-testing/links

On Jul 28, 2004, at 5:46 AM, monsterhtml wrote:

> Dear all,
>   I am newbie of JUnit.
>   Recently, our group create an application. We want to use JUnit as
> tools for performing unit testing. However, I found difficulties that
> test the correctness of JFrame (with other GUI components). Does it
> possible that test by using JUnit, say, the JLabel is appear correct
> caption after some changes. But at the same moment, how can I tigger
> the changes in JUnit?
>   Would you mind teaching me any tips to tackle this problems? Or
> does it has any articles/guide to the implementation of this kind of
> testing??
>
>   Best regards and thanks a lot for kind attention.
>
> Monster~
